p: We suggest, therefore, that a declaration of climate action should allow for both. The difficult question is, what specific laws should it include? This is not a question that we intend to answer in this paper. We will, however, offer a couple of suggestions—to kickstart the debate. Given McKibben’s point about the conflict between the amount of fossil fuel we have, and the amount that can be burnt, one could make a case for a prohibition on new explorations. Engineers should not be permitted, professionally, to work on new coal mines or new oil drilling. Given that gas is quite considerably better than coal, but still worse than renewable energy sources, there would be an argument to be had about whether this prohibition would extend to fracking or not.
